üèÜ Tournament Overview

Who can play in these tournaments?

Any player with a Fargo rating of 445 and below is welcome! You'll need to show your Fargo account and a photo ID at registration.

Who is this tournament for, and why is the Fargo cap so low?

This tournament series is designed to give lower-rated players a competitive and welcoming environment to play and improve. The Portland and Vancouver areas already offer many open and uncapped tournaments (see below), so this event is specifically for those who often find themselves outmatched in higher-level competitions. It's time to give the underdogs their own spotlight!

  • Portland Tournaments
  • Vancouver Tournaments

Note: The Shark Shooter website may show a "connection is not secure" error. You can safely continue past that warning to access tournament information.

üìù Registration & Entry

Do I need to sign up ahead of time?

It‚Äôs recommended but not required! You can submit your Fargo or APA screenshot on the Sign Up page. Your rating will be confirmed live in the Fargo app or assigned by the tournament director at registration before the tournament starts.

I submitted the sign up form, but my name isn't showing up on the bracket or waitlist. What should I do?

Every reservation must be manually reviewed and approved by the tournament director before appearing online. If it's been more than 24 hours since you submitted the form, please text the tournament director to confirm your status.

What if the bracket and/or waitlist on the home page is full?

Even if the bracket and waitlist are full online, the final player list won‚Äôt be determined until registration. Swing by River or text the tournament director before 6:30pm on Thursdays to check for any last-minute spots. We start shooting at 7 PM sharp; while showing up does not guarantee a spot, players who show up in person will always get priority over anyone not present, even if they‚Äôre listed online.

Do I have to have a Fargo account?

Yes. All players must have a Fargo account to participate in River tournaments, as we report every event to Fargo to ensure fair competition for lower-rated players.

How much is the entry fee?

As of June 3, 2025, the entry fee is $15 (cash only) and must be paid at the time of registration. $10 goes directly into the pot, while $5 is an admin fee. Fees can change at the tournament director‚Äôs discretion, and any house donations will be announced at registration.

What is the admin fee?

The $5 admin fee covers the tournament director‚Äôs time, website maintenance and updates, Fargo fees to report tournament results, and other overhead costs needed to keep the tournament running smoothly.
